docs.snippet: Gregory S. Jackson, who was promoted in April to be the chief of staff to the Rutgers president amid a coaching abuse scandal, was already facing his own legal problems....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gregory S. Jackson, who was promoted in April to be the chief of staff to the Rutgers president amid a coaching abuse scandal, was already facing his own legal problems.
docs.abstract: Rutgers officials say Gregory S Jackson was facing his own legal problems when he was promoted in April to be chief of staff to Rutgers president Robert L Barchi amid a coaching abuse scandal; Jackson, sued over alleged age discrimination, is the third Rutgers official to face public criticism over claims of discriminatory or abusive behavior in recent months.

headline.seo: Discrimination Lawsuit Adds to the Spotlight on Rutgers
headline.main: Chief of Staff at Rutgers Facing Discrimination Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Discrimination Suit Adds To Spotlight on Rutgers
